text: [ Elevator dings ]
[ Intercom buzzes ]
-The tea in Nepal is very hot.

-"But the coffee in Peru
is much hotter."

[ Intercom buzzes,
door beeps and unlocks ]

-Last week, I finally
became permanent manager
of Dunder Mifflin Scranton

My first project --
increase security.

I got these doors from
a jewelry store

that had recently
gone out of business.

Now they're protecting America's
real treasure -- paper!

Every morning, I e-mail
the day's security codes.

[ Elevator dings ]
Something that's been really

missing from my life has
been writing secret codes.

It's not the KGB,
but it's a start.
[ Intercom buzzes ]
-The tea in Nepal is very hot.

-But the coffee in Peru
is far hotter.
-Close.
-This is Tuesday, right?

The -- The coffee in
Paraguay is far hotter?
-Colder.

-The coffee in Paraguay
is colder?

-No, I meant you
were getting colder.

The correct response is, "The
coffee in Peru is much hotter.

-Ah, "much," okay.
-But that's three wrong,

so I got to give you the steam
-No!

-Unless you want me
to break protocol.
-[ Sighs ]
No.
No. Give me the steam.
[ Receiver clicks ]
[ Hissing ]

It's just harmless steam
to panic intruders.

I'd like to get harmful steam,
but the prices are absurd.

Break protocol!
Break protocol!
Break protocol!

-Oh, I'm saving a fortune
on dry cleaning.
